intro: Erythrorhipsalis cereuscula, commonly known as the red-horned cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure with spiny stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in arid gardens.
